awd_abstract_narration: This is a continuing project on Pb, Sr and Nd tracer studies of                 carbonatites and alkaline-complex rocks as probes to study the                  geochemical evolution of the Earth's mantle over the past                       3,000,000,000 years.  They now plan to study avariety of specific               rocks; calcites from Finland and Uganda, C and O in                             carbonatites from Uganda, O isotopes from ancient syenites, Hf                  from carbonatites of the Canadian Shield, and Pb, Nd, Sr, O and C               isotopes on carbonatites from the Canary Islands provided by                    LeBas.  There will also be an attempt to obtain carbonatites from               India, China and Greenland.  A new thrust will be a measurement                 of age and isotope patterns of coesite- and almandine-bearing                   rocks from Dora Maira, Italy.  The reasearch will be done in                    collaboration with other workers from Germany, Canada, Italy and                Switzerland.
